TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AvailabilityAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Describes the availability of a member or type in iOS or MacOS.

remarks.para: This attribute is used to annotate when a type or member of a type was introduced, deprecated, obsolete or is unavailable. Thisis done on a per-platform basis (currently Mac OS X and iOS).
The information is only accurate for active versions of the operating systems, the information is removed as soon as operating systems are deprecated or no longer supported by Apple.
It is the managed equivalent of Clang's availability __attribute__, which is the underlying mechanism that Apple uses to perform these annotations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

public AvailabilityAttribute (ObjCRuntime.Platform introduced, ObjCRuntime.Platform deprecated = ObjCRuntime.Platform.None, ObjCRuntime.Platform obsoleted = ObjCRuntime.Platform.None, ObjCRuntime.Platform unavailable = ObjCRuntime.Platform.None);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype ObjCRuntime.Platform introduced, valuetype ObjCRuntime.Platform deprecated, valuetype ObjCRuntime.Platform obsoleted, valuetype ObjCRuntime.Platform unavailable) cil managed

Docs.param: The first version in which an API was introduced for a given platform.

The first version in which the API was deprecated for a given platform; this means users should begin avoiding the API and migrating to a more suitable one, but it still technically works on the platform, but there is no guarantee for how long it will continue to work.

The first version in which the API was obsoleted (removed) from a given platform; this means the API no longer exists and cannot be used at all - a crash at runtime will occur if used on Xamarin. Native code referencing obsolete API will fail to compile (the attribute is enforced by Clang).

The API has never existed in a given platform (e.g. available in iOS but not in Mac); this property is not versioned (can only be Platform.{None,Mac,iOS}) and applies to the entire lifetime (up to present) of a platform. "Unavailable" may be replaced in future versions by an "Introduced."
Docs.summary: Defines the availability range of a particular API.

remarks.para: The entire availability of an API can be expressed either with a single Availability attribute or with multiple. It's entirely style. To demonstrate this, Since, Lion, and MountainLion are now actually subclasses of Availability. This is because we do not want to break API, but also often the more terse attributes are simply nicer to use.
In addition to the AvailabilityAttribute types, there's also which contains a number of useful utilities for working with the Platform enumeration.

example.code:
// // The following examples are all equivalent // [Since (4,0), Lion, Availability (Deprecated = Platform.iOS_6_0 | Platform.Mac_10_8)] ...
[Availability (Introduced = Platform.iOS_4_0)] ...
[Availability (Introduced = Platform.Mac_10_7)] ...
[Availability (Deprecated = Platform.iOS_6_0 | Platform.Mac_10_8)] ...
[Availability ( Introduced = Platform.iOS_4_0 | Platform.Mac_10_7, Deprecated = Platform.iOS_6_0 | Platform.Mac_10_8 )] ...

Docs.summary: Indicates that the member or type can be assumed to always be available (on both OSX and iOS, as well as every version that is currently supported).

the first version in which the API was deprecated for a given platform; this means users should begin avoiding the API and migrating to a more suitable one, but it still technically works on the platform, but there is no guarantee for how long it will continue to work.
Indicates the platforms on which the member or type has been deprecated.
Indicatess the platforms on which the member or type has been deprecated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class ObjCRuntime.AvailabilityAttribute Merge(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<object> attrs) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an availability attribute that is made up of the merged Introduced, Obsoleted, Deprecated and Unavailable properties (including a concatenated version of the message attribute).
the first version in which the API was obsoleted (removed) from a given platform
Docs.remarks: this means the API no longer exists and cannot be used at all - a crash at runtime will occur if used on Xamarin. Native code referencing obsolete API will fail to compile (the attribute is enforced by Clang).

Docs.summary: The architectures on which the obsoleted version applies to.
Indicates the versions on which the feature was obsoleted.
